ITEMS
Ensure that the printer is powered off. Place the extruder module such that the fitting pin is secured in the proper location.
Plug the ribbon connector to the housing located on the extruder module.
Attach the power cord to the power adapter and plug the power adapter to the da Vinci Mini.
Ensure that the guide tube is properly connected to the feeder module.
Feed the other end of the tube through the top and insert it into the extruder module.
Unpeel the bed tape and smoothly apply it to the print bed.
Open spool holder case and pull down the spool holder.
Place the assembled filament spool on spool holder. After which, remember to cut the filament at 45°.
Pull the lever and insert the filament through the feed module.
Remove the side cover by pressing down firmly on the left side of the cover, pushing it apart.
Lower the filament spool holder on the left side of the printer until it is horizontal.
Place the assembled filament spool (with the spool ring) on the spool holder.
Take the tip of the filament and insert it into the feeding hole.
Press the release arm and push the filament all the way to the bottom such that the front end of the filament is completely inserted into the extruder module.
Connect the power cord and power on the Lulzbot Mini. Connect the USB cable to your computer.
Using the software, control the Lulzbot Mini on the interface by the ‘Control’ button.
At the Printer Interface window, raise the hot end of the temperature up to 205°C by typing 205 under “Temperature” and clicking Set.
Proceed to install/replace the filament if needed. Refer to “Installing/Replacing the filament” section for a step-by-step guide.
Using the idler retainer, compress the springs and slide up, allowing the hinged idler to move freely. Then lower the hinged idler counter-clockwise.
Wait until temperature reaches 205°C. After which, pinch the PLA filament loaded in the tool head and remove it by pulling up.

To load filament, face the front of the printer and locate the filament holder mounted to the top right corner of the printer frame. Rotate the filament holder counter-clockwise into an upright position.
Mount the PLA filament sample on the filament holder so that the filament can feed down into the tool head.
Feed the filament through the feed hole in the extruder body.
Compress the springs with the idler retainer and rotate the hinged idler clockwise into an upright position. Lock the hinged idler into place by sliding the idler retainer back down.
Verify the print extrusion by clicking on the Extrude 10 button in the interface and look for filament to feed through the nozzle.
Click Print in the Printer interface window to start the 3D print.
Install the MakerBot Replicator Smart Extruder. Align it with the magnets in place.
Install the spool of the Makerbot PLA Filament.
Once installed, push the filament through the filament guide tube until two inches comes out the other side, and then clip the guide tube in place.
Install the build plate into the body of the printer.
Connect the 3D Printer to the computer using a USB cable as well as to a power supply and power on the switch.
Attach the printing surface to the printer.
Plug the power cord into a standard outlet and plug in the adaptor. Power on the device.
Hold down the ‘OK’ button for five seconds to power on the device.
On the OLED operation screen, select ‘Fast Operation’ or ‘Build from SD’ and press ‘OK’. Select your file and print.
Clip the end of the PLA roll, ensuring that it is flat.
Place the PLA roll in the filament roll area.
Thread the filament through the top of the printer and into the printing head
On the OLED operation screen, press the down button and select ‘Load’.
Wait until the filament is extruding from the nozzle, then press ‘Left’ and ‘OK’ to stop the loading process.
Plug the power cord into the G2. Take note that the main power switch is at the back of the machine, and the on/off switch sat the control panel.
The primary On/Off switch is located on the side of the control panel. This switch is used on a daily basis for turning the G2 On/Off.
Connect the USB cable or Ethernet cable from your computer to the G2. The USB and Ethernet connections are on the left side of the G2.
There are two 4” (100 mm) exhaust ports at the back of the machine. Connect a 350 CFM exhaust fan to the ports and vent to the outside
Thunder Laser Systems Mini-60, Laser Cutter
A machine catered to precision and performance, it is ideal for novices looking to learn and create laser cut projects quickly and efficiently.
Take out the sponge around the laser tube as seen in the picture.
Take out the nylon cable ties around the honey comb plate and X axis. Remove the transparent bag out of the mirror mounts and install the laser head.
Open the rotate emergency switch
Connect the Exhaust System
Connect the Air system
Connect the water cooling system
